statements: SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT last_name, first_name, department FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_id, job_title FROM Employee WHERE hire_date <= '2022-01-01';
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM Employee WHERE termination_date IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM Employee ORDER BY department DESC, hire_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Sales' ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, job_title FROM Employee WHERE termination_date IS NULL;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, department, job_title FROM Employee WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2020-01-01' AND '2021-01-01';
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Marketing' ORDER BY last_name, first_name;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM Employee WHERE termination_date IS NOT NULL ORDER BY hire_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, department FROM employees WHERE department='IT';
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE hire_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM employees JOIN employee_turnover ON employees.employee_id = employee_turnover.employee_id ORDER BY turnover_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY last_name ASC, first_name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY first_name, last_name;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2020-01-01' AND '2021-01-01';
SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, et.turnover_date, et.reason FROM employees e JOIN employee_turnover et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id WHERE et.turnover_date >= '2020-01-01';
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC, department ASC;
SELECT * FROM employee_data;
SELECT name, age FROM employee_data ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS total_count FROM employee_data GROUP BY department;
SELECT name, department FROM employee_data WHERE age > 30;
SELECT employee_id, name, gender FROM employee_data JOIN workforce_demographics ON employee_data.department = workforce_demographics.department;
SELECT name, age, department FROM employee_data WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM turnover_data WHERE turnover_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31' ORDER BY turnover_date DESC LIMIT 20;
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) as total_employees FROM employee_data GROUP BY department HAVING total_employees > 5 ORDER BY total_employees DESC;
SELECT department, gender, AVG(average_tenure) as avg_tenure FROM workforce_demographics WHERE gender = 'Female' GROUP BY department ORDER BY avg_tenure DESC;

SELECT e.name as Employee_Name, d.department as Department, t.reason as Turnover_Reason FROM employee_data e LEFT JOIN turnover_data t ON e.employee_id = t.employee_id LEFT JOIN workforce_demographics d ON e.department = d.department WHERE t.employee_id IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeInformation;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE department = 'Engineering';
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM EmployeeInformation ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT department, MAX(years_of_service) AS max_years_of_service FROM WorkforceDemographics GROUP BY department;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, t.rate, t.reason FROM EmployeeInformation e INNER JOIN TurnoverRates t ON e.employee_id = t.employee_id WHERE t.rate > 5;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM EmployeeInformation WHERE hire_date >= '2020-01-01';
SELECT employee_id, rate, reason FROM TurnoverRates ORDER BY rate DESC, employee_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM RetentionStrategies WHERE CHAR_LENGTH(description) > 100;
SELECT department, AVG(age) AS avg_age FROM WorkforceDemographics GROUP BY department;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeInformation INNER JOIN TurnoverRates ON EmployeeInformation.employee_id = TurnoverRates.employee_id WHERE TurnoverRates.rate > 3.5;
SELECT * FROM employee;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM employee WHERE department='Sales';
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, salary FROM employee ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee WHERE hire_date > '2020-01-01';
SELECT employee_id, department, COUNT(*) as total FROM employee GROUP BY department;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, department, salary FROM employee WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT * FROM department WHERE department_name = 'Sales';
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, department, hire_date FROM employee WHERE department = 'HR' ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, salary FROM employee WHERE salary BETWEEN 40000 AND 60000 ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT d.department_name, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS num_employees FROM employee e JOIN department d ON e.department = d.department_name GROUP BY d.department_name;
